title: New: St. Spirit – Build A Life / Ferrous Vessel
content:
St.

Spirit are hardly reinventing epic indie-pop, yet there’s something rather adorable about these two tracks from the London outfit. Stating one of my all time favourite records as a major influence, in the form of My Bloody Valentine’s Loveless; it’s slightly bemusing then that these two tracks bare very little, if any resemblance to the classic 1991 album. However that’s not to say Build A Life and Ferrous Vessel aren’t worthy of praise in their own right. ‘A Side’ Build A Life begins placidly before launching into a stomping three minutes of pulse-racing post-rock inspired indie; soaring guitars and crisp vocals included. The chorus, consisting of ‘Come on son, you don’t know what you’re missing, sex, death and repetition blues.’ proves distinctly memorable. Whereas Ferrous Vessel is a slower, more calculated track; siphoning off the intensity found on Build A Life, echoing Brand New at times. Light comparisons could be drawn to The Twilight Sad and Explosions in the Sky, yet the most obvious act to draw a likeness between are Oxford’s Spring Offensive. Check out both tracks below, which are released as free downloads from tomorrow.
